name: PKI System Administrator (2025-3496)
description:
IMPORTANT INFORMATION

(An identified breach will result in an immediate removal from the distribution list)

  1. Only applications that meet exactly the BNB’s selection criteria (skills, work experience, language skills and availability) can be proposed.
  2. Make sure that the proposed candidate name is written correctly, and that his/her name is the same as mentioned on its official identification document (ID).

If your candidate is selected for a contract, you will be asked to provide us with a copy of its ID card, an ID picture and the postal address of the candidate.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

NBB institution:

  • The National Bank of Belgium is an institution that works towards the stability of the financial system.
  • The National Bank contributes to creating a climate of confidence conducive to the well-being of all.

Context

The NBB is looking for a Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) system administrator to manage, maintain and support its IDNomic OpenTrust PKI, Entrust nShield Hardware Security Modules (HSMs) and an Ascertia Online Status Protocol (OCSP) server. The PKI system administrator will be responsible for creating, maintaining and supporting the Thales Safenet Authentication Client.

The PKI system administrator assists NBB colleagues with troubleshooting private key, public key certificate, certificate authority, Certificate Revocation List (CRL), OCSP, … issues they encounter.

Requirements

The PKI administrator has a good knowledge of OpenSSL, she/he can generate public/private keys, certificate signing requests (CSRs), review public key certificates and certificate revocation lists (CRLs) and change between different public key certificate and CRL formatting types (base64 and Distinguished Encoding Rules (DER). She/he is able to bundle private keys/public key certificates, intermediate and root CAs into PKCS#7 (Public Key Cryptography Standard) and PKCS#12 format.

The PKI administrator supports the lifecyle (create, renew, revoke, …) of root certification authorities, as well as generate and publish their CRLs.

The PKI administrator maintains and supports Thales SafeNet Client, the software that is used to support the Thales SafeNet hardware tokens.

The PKI administrator supports and maintains the Ascertia OCSP Server: keep the CRL URL (Uniform Resource Locator) location(s), OCSP forwarding location (s) up-to-date for the certificate authorities the OCSP Servers responds for, debug issues and apply upgrades and patches.  

The PKI administrator supports and maintains the Entrust nShield Connect HSMs that contain the intermediate CAs private keys. Generate, renew and delete keys, upgrade the HSM’s firmware and server software.

The PKI administrator will obtain third-party TLS certificates: prepare, order and support business entities in obtaining those certificates

The PKI administrator will assist IT staff with general certificate requests, deployment, questions & issues.

The PKI administrator will automate and document PKI workflows & tasks.

Knowledge of OpenSSL is a must, knowledge of certutil is a plus.

Knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory Certificate Services (ADCS) and Redhat Certificate System is a plus.

The system administrator will be working at least half of the time of the assignment on-site at the NBB headquarters.

Occupation

  • Half-time mission 
  • 50% on-site minimum
  • Extension possible

 

ProUnity/Staffing MS is the single point of contact (SPOC) for this mission.

If you have any questions, please contact Marianne Schoos, Client Satisfaction Manager, by e-mail at EPCO@pro-unity.com.
